{{infobox football tournament | logo = | caption = | founded = 2000 | region = [[Western Asia]] ([[West Asian Football Federation|WAFF]]) | number of teams = 9 (finals) | current champions = {{fb|KUW}} (1st title) | most successful team = {{fb|IRN}}
(4 titles) | website = | current = [[2010 West Asian Football Federation Championship|Current Season]] }} The '''West Asian Football Federation Championship''' is a football competition of mainly West Asian countries and territories. The event is organised by [[West Asian Football Federation]]. It is usually held every two years, but at occasionally longer intervals. ==Men's Football Tournaments== {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%; width: 95%; text-align: center;" |- !rowspan=2 width=5%|Year !rowspan=2 width=10%|Host |width=1% rowspan=6| !colspan=3|Final |width=1% rowspan=6| !colspan=3|Third Place Match |- !width=15%|Winner !width=8%|Score !width=15%|Runner-up !width=15%|3rd Place !width=8%|Score !width=15%|4th Place |- style="background: #D0E6FF;" |2000

{{fb|UAE}} (2 titles each) | website = | current = [[2011 West Asian Football Federation Women's Championship|Current Season]] }} The countries that competed in one or more tournaments are [[Iran women's national football team|Iran]], [[Jordan women's national football team|Jordan]], [[Palestine women's national football team|Palestine]], [[Lebanon women's national football team|Lebanon]], [[Bahrain women's national football team|Bahrain]], [[Iraq women's national football team|Iraq]], and [[Syria women's national football team|Syria]]. {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%; width: 95%; text-align: center;" |- !rowspan=2 width=5%|Year !rowspan=2 width=10%|Host |width=1% rowspan=6| !colspan=3|Final |width=1% rowspan=6| !colspan=3|Third Place Match |- !width=15%|Winner !width=8%|Score !width=15%|Runner-up !width=15%|3rd Place !width=8%|Score !width=15%|4th Place |- style="background: #D0E6FF;" |2005
